column4: This resource is a mirror (reasonably faithful reproduction) of the referenced resource. This is a VOResource 1.0 term deprecated in favour of IsIdenticalTo.
This resource makes data from the referenced resource (typcally some sort for data collection) available. This is a VOResource 1.0 term deprecated in favour of IsServiceFor.
This resource can be accessed or otherwise used through the referenced service.  This is a VOResource 1.0 term deprecated in favour of IsServedBy.
This resource was produced using data from the referenced resource.  This is a VOResource 1.0 term deprecated in favour of IsDerivedFrom.
This resource has some unspecified relationship to the referenced resource.  This is a VOResource 1.0 term that should no longer be used in new resource records.  Use specific terms instead.

This resource makes use of the referenced resource.  This is in particular to reference tools like programs from educational material like tutorials.  It is not intended to track citations in a bibliographic sense.
This resource augments the referenced resource (inverse  of IsSupplementedBy)
Additional material pertaining to this resource  is available at the referenced resource (inverse of IsSupplementedTo)
This resource has been or will be discontinued, and clients should turn to the referenced resource (inverse of Continues)
This resource has taken up the service of the referenced resource (inverse of IsContinuedBy)
The referenced resource has been developed on, and this resource should be used in preference (inverse of IsPreviousVersionOf)
This resource has been developed on, and the referenced resource should be used for more up-to-date information (inverse of NewVersionOf)
The referenced resource is a collection of some sort, perhaps a series, and this resource is a part of that collection (inverse of HasPart)
This is resource is a collection of other resources, and this relationship points to the individual parts (inverse of IsPartOf)
This is resource has been used to produce the referenced resource (inverse of derived-from)
This resource was produced using data from the referenced resource (inverse of IsSourceOf)

This resource is identical to the referenced resource, for use when there is a need to register two separate instances of the same resource.  In a VO context, this will typcially indicate mirrors operated by different publishers (mirrors with identical publishers use interface/mirrorURL elements).
This resource makes data from the referenced resource (typcally some sort for data collection) available (inverse of IsServedBy)
This resource can be accessed or otherwise used through the referenced service (inverse of IsServiceFor)
